questions.question_text: From a risk management perspective, which of the following is the PRIMARY benefit of using automated system configuration validation tools?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Residual risk is reduced.

Automated system configuration validation tools help reduce the residual risk, which is the risk that remains after controls and mitigation efforts have been implemented. By automatically identifying and rectifying configuration errors and vulnerabilities, these tools help ensure that systems are operating in a secure and compliant manner. This, in turn, reduces the likelihood of security incidents and breaches, ultimately lowering the residual risk to the organization.
An automated validation tool will most likely reduce the likelihood of the incorrect configuration which will reduce the risk risk.

comments.content: D is right in my view.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I go with "B". Manual validation is more costly, think of this as man-days. Automated validation will make the process more efficient with less cost. For option "D", I do believe that the automated validation is not necessarily will reduce the Residual risk, is some cases it will find more vulnerabilities not rectified compared to manual validation i.e. the residual risk is increased
